intro: Thaspium, commonly known as the common thaspium, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. These plants are characterized by their slender, often hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. The flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in umbels, which is a common feature in the carrot family. Thaspium species are often found in disturbed soils and open areas, such as roadsides and fields. They are generally herbaceous and can be found across various regions in Europe and Asia.
